children.subject: Unfortunately, we are done taking applications at this time
Hi, I wanted to apply for the rolling applications, but the form is closed. Does this mean there will be no rolling apps?
Yes, they will be released tomarrow morningish

history.content:
Would you like to pass some of your computer science knowledge down to others? Would you like to better your grip on fundamental CS material? Would you like to take your first steps toward joining the CS 61B course staff? If logical-or-ing your answers to the above questions == true, please consider becoming an Academic Intern for CS61B Fall 2021!

 

As an intern you will help facilitate labs by helping students with their assignments and conceptual understanding of the class.

 

All interns will be expected to:

  • Be on campus for the entirety of the Fall semester. Interning for 61B is a primarily in person activity and fully remote students are not eligible to become interns.

  • Attend a pre-semester talk about the program / instructing students.

  • Have one half hour mid-semester meeting with your TA and their other interns.

  • Regularly submit assignments to the autograder (these are the same assignments students will be completing).

  • Fill out the mid-semester survey.

  • Attend 80% of your required labs. There may be some make up opportunities available. Each lab will be two hours long.

 

This internship is designed to take roughly 3 hours of your time per week. Labs must be attended in person but other duties can be completed asynchronously. The lab will be made available to you in advance and will be accompanied by a walkthrough video (ft. me). You are required to complete the lab and submit to Gradescope in preparation for your lab.

 

Although we are explicitly recruiting for labs, there may be opportunities to help out with project office hours throughout the semester. This will be optional, but if you have completed Gitlet or Enigma in the past we may ask you to help out.

 

For your time and effort as an Intern, you will be awarded 1 unit of PNP credit for the Fall 2021 semester. Completing all of the above bullet points will get you a P. You cannot become an intern without taking the class for a unit.

 

The Application is Available Here. It is officially due Sunday, August 22nd, at 11:59pm PDT, but depending on demand we may accept rolling applications up through August 24 (the day before school starts). Expect decisions during the first week of classes.

 

Here are some common questions I always get about applying to be an intern:

 

Do I need to have gotten an A in 61B to apply?

 

No, the application process is grade blind (the application does not even ask for your grade in 61B). You are selected based off your answers to the application questions. Potential applicants often express to me that they do not feel "qualified" for the position, but in my experience they always are. This is as much as opportunity for you to learn the material a second time as it is to get teaching experience.

 

I am undecided if I want to apply, should I?

 

If you are considering becoming an intern but unsure if you can commit to it, I would recommend filling the application out anyways. You will have a chance to turn the position down if you are accepted but cannot accept.

 

What times are available for labs?

 

This will not be decided until closer towards the semester. Labs are normally W-F. Take a look at last semester's website to get an idea what the schedule might look like.




Please comment here with any further questions or email me at alexschedel@berkeley.edu if you have any other questions.
